purpose: The email announces the Call for Papers (CFP) for accepted workshops at the ACM/IEEE 28th International Conference on Model Driven Engineering Languages and Systems (MODELS 2025), which will take place from October 5-10, 2025, in Grand Rapids, Michigan. It highlights that the conference will be a hybrid event allowing both in-person and virtual participation. The email provides details about the workshops, including their objectives, organizers, and links to their respective websites. Important deadlines for submissions, notifications, and camera-ready versions are also included, along with a list of the accepted workshops and their themes.

conf_name_candidates.evidence: MODELS 2025, including the workshops, will be organized as a hybrid event with in-person and virtual participation.

evidence_sentences: MODELS 2025 will host a number of workshops during the three days before the main conference.
The workshops will provide a collaborative forum for a group of typically 15 to 30 participants to exchange recent and/or preliminary results.
Important dates: Thu 3 Jul 2025 Submissions Deadline, Thu 31 Jul 2025 Notification of Authors, Thu 7 Aug 2025 Camera-ready Deadline.
MODELS 2025, including the workshops, will be organized as a hybrid event with in-person and virtual participation.
A list of the accepted workshops is available below, with links to workshop websites.
